contentrichtext.text: '''Xenia Station''', located at 150 Miami Avenue in [[Xenia, Ohio|Xenia]], [[Ohio]], in the [[United States]], is a [[replica]] of Xenia's 1880s brick [[railroad station]]. Built in 1998 by the city of Xenia, Xenia Station houses a local history museum, a classroom/meeting space and an observation tower called the '''Hub Lookout'''. Xenia Station is the hub for 5 regional [[rail trails]], two of which are segments of the unfinished [[Ohio to Erie Trail]], which will run from [[Cincinnati, Ohio|Cincinnati]] to [[Cleveland, Ohio|Cleveland]].<ref name="miamivalleytrails.org">[http://www.miamivalleytrails.org/station.htm Miami Valley Bike Trails - Xenia Station]</ref><ref name="xenia.dreamhosters.com">[http://www.xenia.dreamhosters.com/index.php?page=parks City of Xenia site for Xenia Station]</ref> ==Facilities== {{tocright}} Xenia Station was custom built in 1998 for the city of Xenia by a local contractor<ref>[http://www.matthewscontractor.com/commercial_projects.html David Metthews]</ref> and is located on a {{convert|9|acre|m2|sing=on}} city park of the same name, which has play equipment, picnic tables, a picnic shelter, nature areas, a [[caboose]] and off-street parking. The site is the former B&O freight yards. The building's first floor houses a local history museum which includes railroad memorabilia while the second floor has a classroom/meeting space. Xenia Station is also the hub for 5 regional [[rail trails]], two of which are segments of the unfinished Ohio to Erie Trail, which will run from Cincinnati to Cleveland. In addition to the museum and classroom/meeting space, the building also has restrooms, vending machines and water for the [[bicyclists]], [[hikers]] and others who use the park. It also has a large map of the rail trails and the Hub Lookout, which is a tower accessible by spiral staircase that provides a panoramic view of the rail trails.<ref name="miamivalleytrails.org"/><ref name="xenia.dreamhosters.com"/> ==Railroad history== As late as 1960, Xenia had 3 railroads running through it, as follows: * The [[Baltimore and Ohio Railroad|B&O]] [[Wellston, Ohio|Wellston]] subdivision, which ran between [[Washington Court House, Ohio|Washington Court House]] and [[Dayton, Ohio|Dayton]]; * The [[Pennsylvania Railroad]]'s Little Miami branch, between Cincinnati and [[Springfield, Ohio|Springfield]]: and * The Pennsylvania Railroad's [[Main Line (Pittsburgh to St. Louis)|Pittsburgh to St. Louis mainline]]. [[Amtrak]] used this line for the National Limited until 1979. All 3 railroads were discontinued and dismantled by 1979 or shortly thereafter. ==Rail trails== The crossing of these 3 railroad rights-of-way created 6 spokes on a wheel with Xenia Station in the center. Of these 6 spokes, 5 have been or are being converted to [[rail trail]]s. The one exception was the B&O line west to Dayton which did not become a trail because it closely paralleled the Pennsylvania mainline to Dayton.<ref name="miamivalleytrails.org"/> Clockwise from the north, the 5 rails trails are:<ref name="miamivalleytrails.org"/> ===North=== The northern branch of the [[Little Miami Scenic Trail]] runs from Xenia to [[Yellow Springs, Ohio|Yellow Springs]] and on to [[Springfield, Ohio|Springfield]]. ===Northeast=== The Prairie Grass Trail (a part of the [[Ohio to Erie Trail]]) runs from Xenia to [[Cedarville, Ohio|Cedarville]] and to [[London, Ohio|London]] and beyond. ===East=== The Xenia-Jamestown Connector will run from Xenia to [[Jamestown, Ohio|Jamestown]] and beyond, but there is now a short gap from Xenia Station to Jasper Road. ===South=== The southern branch of the Little Miami Scenic Trail is a part of the [[Ohio to Erie Trail]] and runs from Xenia to [[Milford, Ohio|Milford]] and beyond. ===West=== The Creekside Trail, known as the Creekside Recreation Trail in [[Montgomery County, Ohio|Montgomery County]], runs from Xenia to [[Dayton, Ohio|Dayton]]. ==See also== *[[Columbus and Xenia Railroad]] * [[Little Miami Railroad]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.miamivalleytrails.org/station.htm Miami Valley Bike Trails -
